newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portuguese bonds end higher with foreign markets.
newsitem.headline: Portuguese bonds end higher with foreign markets.

text.p: Portuguese bonds closed higher in sympathy with stronger European and U.S. markets, and dealers expected the positive sentiment to spill over into Friday with attention focused on U.S. payrolls data.
Spreads between 10-year bonds and Bonos should remain in a range between zero and five basis points (bp), they said.
"Tomorrow the prices will be well-supported and firmer with attention focused on U.S. payrolls data," one operator said.

The escudo strengthened during today's session and broke through support at 100.00 per mark despite intervention by the Bank of Portugal to buy marks, dealers said. The escudo closed at 99.95/00 per mark.
